fields.description: The cluster delta health policy defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster during a cluster upgrade.
fields.name: DeltaHealthPolicy

fields.description: If true, then processes are forcefully restarted during upgrade even when the code version has not changed (the upgrade only changes configuration or data).
fields.name: ForceRestart

fields.description: The cluster health policy defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster during a cluster upgrade.
fields.name: HealthPolicy

fields.description: The cluster monitoring policy describes the parameters for monitoring an upgrade in Monitored mode.
fields.name: MonitoringPolicy

fields.description:
The maximum amount of time to block processing of an upgrade domain and prevent loss of availability when there are unexpected issues.
When this timeout expires, processing of the upgrade domain will proceed regardless of availability loss issues.
The timeout is reset at the start of each upgrade domain. The timeout can be in either hh:mm:ss or in d.hh:mm:ss.ms format.
This value must be between 00:00:00 and 49710.06:28:15 (unsigned 32 bit integer for seconds)
fields.name: UpgradeReplicaSetCheckTimeout
